name: Easy Gyoza Wrappers Recipe
description: Easy gyoza wrappers recipe for making delicious homemade gyoza dumplings!
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup all purpose flour (for sprinkling the dough with flour, step 2)

recipeInstructions.text: Add all-purpose flour and salt to a mixing bowl and make a well in the center. Very slowly pour in warm water, mixing as you go. Take your time to gradually add the water as you mix to shape it into a shaggy dough!
recipeInstructions.name: Add all-purpose flour and salt to a mixing bowl and make a well in the center. Very slowly pour in warm water, mixing as you go. Take your time to gradually add the water as you mix to shape it into a shaggy dough!

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle some flour onto a clean rolling surface and transfer your dough to it. Then, knead the dough for about 5–10 minutes, adding a sprinkle of flour occasionally. Keep going for about 5 to 10 minutes, until your dough feels nice and elastic.
recipeInstructions.name: Sprinkle some flour onto a clean rolling surface and transfer your dough to it. Then, knead the dough for about 5–10 minutes, adding a sprinkle of flour occasionally. Keep going for about 5 to 10 minutes, until your dough feels nice and elastic.

recipeInstructions.text: Once your dough is kneaded to perfection, form it into a ball and let it rest in a bowl covered with plastic wrap for about 30 minutes to 1 hour. This makes it smoother and easier to roll out and shape later on.
recipeInstructions.name: Once your dough is kneaded to perfection, form it into a ball and let it rest in a bowl covered with plastic wrap for about 30 minutes to 1 hour. This makes it smoother and easier to roll out and shape later on.

recipeInstructions.text: After the dough has rested, divide it in half and roll it out into a thin sheet. The goal is to get it as thin as possible without tearing.
recipeInstructions.name: After the dough has rested, divide it in half and roll it out into a thin sheet. The goal is to get it as thin as possible without tearing.

recipeInstructions.text: Use a round object or dumpling mold to punch out your wrappers from the rolled dough. Repeat until you're out of dough. Keep your wrappers from sticking by lightly dusting them with cornstarch. Lay them out on a baking sheet, not letting them overlap, and cover them with plastic wrap. Store them for later or use them immediately!
recipeInstructions.name: Use a round object or dumpling mold to punch out your wrappers from the rolled dough. Repeat until you're out of dough. Keep your wrappers from sticking by lightly dusting them with cornstarch. Lay them out on a baking sheet, not letting them overlap, and cover them with plastic wrap. Store them for later or use them immediately!
